{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3326126,"name":"ErickFlores","username":"dietriixx","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T20:59:33.893Z","cooked":"

For our shooter we have 2 NEOS that can go free and use them. We can add them a 4:1 sport gearbox, or we can use two 550 with a 4:1 sport gearbox.
What should we implement and lock??
And what rpms have worked the most, we can possibly shoot from the wing, but we have to know .

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T20:59:33.893Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":143,"readers_count":142,"score":78.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457610,"topic_slug":"shooter","display_username":"ErickFlores","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63824,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"dietriixx"},"post_url":"/t/shooter/457610/1","custom_user_title":"dietriixx","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3326131,"name":"Joshua Epperson","username":"jepperson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/74df32/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T21:01:34.170Z","cooked":"

You want to be aiming for about 6000-10k rpm. What teams have been doing is making a step-up reduction to make the controls on the code side easier so they only have to accelerate to like 60% speed of the motor for the shot to work so it leaves headroom. You would not want to be a gear reduction on a neo, and I would honestly not even consider using 775s or neo 550s as they will take a long time to accelerate up to speed

It depends greatly on wheel diameter and compression. Wheel diameter however will mostly be the primary factor. The larger the wheel at the same RPM, the greater the surface speed for shooting out the note.

Short answer, I think 4:1 gearing will be too slow unless your wheels are quite large.

1:1, or simply no gearbox reduction may be a good place to start tuning your specific shooter with typical size (3-4") wheels. Feel free to reply with more details on your shooter and people can help with more specific examples that have worked for them. Or you could check out some of the great Open Alliance build threads on here as well.

We are running 1:1 on a Neo 1.1 with 3" wheels 1/2" compression. (one neo on top roller, one neo on the other, NOT geared together as a requirement for amp scoring)). Primarily shooting from the subwoofer area at ~70% power. Hope this helps.
